reviews.review: A great combination of classic run and shoot gameplay inspired by Doom along with arena styled fights. Half Life is a game that kicks off a universe with an excellent storyline along with memorable sequels. 10/10 would erase memory to play again.
Uno de los mejores shooters noventeros, impresionantes graficos, una trama interesante, se los recomiendo para los que no tienen una pc para jugar Black mesa 10/10

Um jogo que marcou minha inf√¢ncia na √©poca de sucesso do CS 1.6, onde eu ainda jogava no computador da empresa dos meus familiares pelo dif√≠cil acesso aos computadores, nos anos 2000. 

Uma tem√°tica bem inovadora, estreando nos jogos com contexto cient√≠fico de muta√ß√µes. Tenho que admitir, a imensa criatividade dos produtores da Valve pela cria√ß√£o desse universo e de todos seus detalhes s√£o admir√°veis, foi a√≠ j√° que eu comecei a me tornar um f√£ da produtora. 

Embora o p√∫blico hoje adore cobrar conte√∫do de seu protagonista, eu adorava o sil√™ncio do Dr. Gordon Freeman, transpirava um suspense interativo que me deixava sempre curioso para saber o que est√° por vir, essa sensa√ß√£o de sil√™ncio para faze-lo se sentir no ambiente do jogo funcionou para mim, e eu sou um imenso f√£ do personagem em toda franquia Half-Life. 

Os inimigos s√£o bem diversificados, alguns f√°ceis, outros muito dif√≠ceis, outros bem chatos. Durante a partida d√° para tomar muitos sustos e nervoso com os que pulam em voc√™, agonia pelos que te puxam pela l√≠ngua no teto sem que se perceba e etc. 

√â um jogo que mesmo antigo, vale a pena sentir essa sensa√ß√£o de uma das febres do in√≠cio do seculo.

Half-Life is a FPS classic with great exposition and storytelling with varied map design and a crowbar.

[b]pros[/b]
+ iconic
+ graphics
+ exposition
+ story
+ map design
+ puzzles

[b]cons[/b]
- average gunplay 1. no staggering enemies 2. lack of blood & gore
- bad boss fight
- no subtitles
- some won't like the platforming

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Half-Life 1 is a classic FPS that every fan of the genre needs to have played. However, if you are new to the game, you might as well play the free coop version Sven coop with your friends. If you want a more bloody and gory version, play brutal half-life.

Genre: FPS
Replay value: average-high
Rating: 8.5/10
Recommendation: Yes
Special endorsement: Yes

Although this game was one of the legendary narrative FPS games that pioneered the genre during its time, the gameplay does not hold up by todays standard. The narrative though, is fantastic. I did not play this game for more than 2 hours when I was young at a friend's house, so this would be my first playthrough.

Playing this on the hardest difficulty will have you dying extremely frequently through little fault of the player. Enemy spawns are cheap at times, forcing the player to constantly reload saves and memorise enemy spawn locations. Enemies are bullet sponges and require a ton of effort to take down. Movement is extremely wonky and freeman feels like he's sliding on ice, making the platforming in this game (there is a lot) painful. Most enemies cannot miss so strafing does absolutely nothing, forcing the player to hide behind cover most of the time and peek once in a while.  Eventually I had to quicksave far too often to prevent random damage from enemies or from fall damage which makes the game too frustrating to recommend playing on the hardest difficulty. The game also bugged out on my numerous times forcing me to load to an earlier part of the level because the game would not progress no matter what I did

Narratively though it still stands out and the pacing of the game is really good. It manages to tell a story through the environment and some dialogue from random enemies or npcs only and does not force the story down the player's throat unlike most narrative FPS today.


If you would like to try this game out do not play on the hardest difficulty on your first playthrough like I did.

Una obra maestra que marco un antes y un despu√©s en la historia de los videojuegos, y los FPS en particular, con una trama magn√≠ficamente contada, mec√°nicas incre√≠bles aun hoy en d√≠a y mas aun para su √©poca, un juego de acci√≥n fren√©tica y dura, con varios detalles y con ciertamente unos gr√°ficos que ni para la √©poca ni para hoy en d√≠a son espectaculares, pero que sin dudas no desagradan.
Por hablar se podr√≠an decir muchas cosas asombrosas de este videojuego, como que gracias a el existen sagas como Counter Strike, Team Fortress y tambi√©n otras muchas franquicias que beben directamente de este Half-Life 1, pero para sintetizar y no alargar una rese√±a que pretendo sea concisa.
Este es quiz√° uno de los mejores videojuegos de la historia y sea la √©poca que sea le debes dar una oportunidad.

Cheguei algumas d√©cadas atrasada para a festa de Half-Life, mas agora s√≥ consigo pensar em comprar a sequel e todos os DLCs. √â basicamente o av√¥ dos jogos de FPS, abriu as portas para esse g√™nero como o conhecemos hoje e tudo mais, e realmente faz jus a esse status. Tem uma hist√≥ria √≥tima de fic√ß√£o cient√≠fica, √© mega divertido e, enquanto algumas de suas mec√¢nicas s√£o bem pr√≥prias do seu tempo (leia-se "frustrantes": n√£o me surpreenderia se os minutos que gastei tentando acertar alguns saltos ou escorregando pra fora de escadas somassem 1h do total da minha jogatina, sem contar que se bobear o Freeman se move a 80km/h), d√° pra perceber que outras j√° s√£o muito a frente daquela era de 1998.

Inclusive, quem reclamar que os gr√°ficos s√£o "ruins demais para se jogar" foi criado na base de leite com p√™ra e PS4. Pra um neg√≥cio que roda at√© numa batata t√° mais que maravilhoso.

Recomendado para: todo mundo nessa porra. E quem jogar e curtir, tem tamb√©m um spin-off em que voc√™ joga do ponto de vista dos militares (Half-Life: Opposing Force) e um do guardinha de azul que s√≥ queria ir pra casa tomar uma cervejinha mas vai ter que fazer hora extra no caos alien√≠gena do seu trampo (quem nunca? Brutal Half-Life review
Here I wasn't planning on beating this game again, since I have played Caged, Paranoia and USS Darkstar recently, also beat Black Mesa not so long ago too when it was a mod, then loaded it as a standalone game on steam just to check how much it has improved. Beat Half-life Source when I wanted to remember the original game with its original gameplay. Then Blue Shift and Opposing force as I never beat them as a kid. 
BUT, then I saw Brutal Half-Life modification in open beta 2 and decided to give it a go just to try out gameplay. Well, what turned out to be a try out for a couple of hours, made me beat the game once more. And I have to say it was soo darn good I just had to come back to playing this gib brutal fest even though I know the game so well and it didn't feel like enough time has passed to replay it again. But I just couldn't stop. 

Gameplay has changed so drastically, it felt so modern and fast paced. More fast paced than Black Mesa. I could say this Brutal mod makes this game rival Black Mesa because it feels like a remake too. You can shoot off any body part off any enemy, make them mash potatoes etc.  You can dual wield all pistols, there is deagle from opposing force, you can aim down sights, dual wield mp5s, there are even quake and doom guns but those aren't available in normal game unless you cheat but the game also has a few test levels of Quake and Doom instead of Hazard Course. There is lots of blood. And crowbar pales in comparison to ninja fists and kick of Gordon Freeman. 

Hell kick is so useful it was one of my favorite things to do. It is fast, it is very strong and can blow enemies into pieces. Besides you don't have to switch to crowbar when you want to melee with a weapon in hand. I often killed headcrabs with 2 kicks on normal. At the start of the game I went full melee against hounds using fists and legs. It was very fast and effective and cool too. So yeah, this playthrough I didn't use crowbar at all. Unless it is remade cooler than fists and legs then it is not needed. In the final parts of the game after Freeman was abducted, I didn't even pick it up. Also, kick and fists can destroy most anything in terms of interior. And I found it really useful kicking tanks down to 1 health so I could 1 shot them from glock. 

The mod has a couple of issues like sometimes weird hitboxes but those were rare and I just needed to learn how to shoot new guns. The worst hitboxes were on barnacles (hanging monsters who try to reel you in) so I just ended up avoiding them instead of wasting ammo into nothing. It also crashes sometimes, especially if you reload during a map change. And sometimes if you save and load while reloading your gun will be stuck until you change it, which is like gun jamming so just avoid doing that or it will be bad for you if you are surrounded. 

But honestly these issues are so small, they didn't stop me from beating this game with this mod. It was a breathe. Just make sure to quick save often and you will be golden if it crashes. Saves do not disappear and work even if it crashes during a save. So even when the game crashes on me (which was rare) it only took me 10 seconds to get back in.  And as I have played this game before I was like a malestorm running through it. So don't just stand there, get Brutal Half-Life ffs!
Just get it. Trust me.
